mvp.core

Class AbstractController

  • java.lang.Object
    • mvp.core.AbstractController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractListenerController

    @ThreadSafe
public abstract class AbstractController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
    Abstract controller class with the basic structure for managing a program following the Model-View-Presenter design pattern. It provides methods to add/remove models that extend the AbstractPropertyModel class and views that implement the PropertyChangeView interface. It is not meant to be used with other view/model classes that do not apply this MVP framework.

    In addition to maintaining lists of registered models and views, this class has powerful reflective getter and setter methods to modify the models it is assigned. setModelProperty(String,Object...) and getModelProperty(String,Object...) are designed to call upon any public "get" or "set" method in any model class, so long as the property name is synonymous with the method name. This allows subclasses to modify the models assigned to this controller without needing any direct knowledge of their implementation.

    The only restriction on these two methods is they will only successfully invoke a method that matches the name and parameters provided once. If more than one matching method exists across the instances of the models added to this controller, only the first one found will be invoked. This is to ensure a consistent ability to return a value, if necessary. Because of this, it is highly recommended to keep all property names unique, and not to add multiple instances of the same model to this controller.

    Lastly, this controller functions as a PropertyChangeListener. All models added to this class have this controller added as a listener for any PropertyChangeEvents they fire. Any events received will be passed to all the views registered with this controller. The individual views will be responsible for determining if they need to respond to the event or not.

    THREAD SAFETY: This class is completely thread safe. The lists containing the registered models and views are both synchronized lists, and thread safety is delegated to them. Iteration of those lists in this class is synchronized on the intrinsic lock of the lists. Any iteration of those lists by subclasses needs to do the same.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Craig
    See Also:
    PropertyChangeView, AbstractPropertyModel

      • getModelProperty

        protected final java.lang.Object getModelProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
                                                  java.lang.Object... newParams)
                                           throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                                  java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                                  java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException,
                                                  java.lang.Exception
        Invokes the getter method for the named property on one of the models assigned to this controller. This method is invoked through reflection using the provided parameters. If the property name submitted is not a property contained by the models assigned to this controller, an exception will be thrown. If the getter invoked throws an exception, or if the reflective method is unable to successfully invoke the method, the appropriate exception will be thrown.

        This method is capable of reflectively invoking ANY method provided to it, so long as that method is public and matches the types of the parameters submitted here. However, if multiple methods that would invoke successfully are provided in the list, this method will only end up invoking one of them. Multiple invocations risk interfering with the consistency of the return type, and therefore this method ends after the first successful invocation even if there are other methods remaining to test.

        The order of the methods is affected by the order models were added to this controller, but ultimately the order they are tested in cannot be completely guaranteed. As such, it is highly recommended to keep method names across all the models added to this controller unique, thus avoiding this issue.

        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property to invoke the setter of.
        newParams - the parameters to pass to the getter method. These are optional, and the method will still run if no parameters are passed if the getter can accept a no-argument invocation.
        Returns:
        the return value of the method invoked.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if no matching getter method can be found. if the application does not have access to invoke the method.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the application does not have access to invoke the method.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any or all of the parameters submitted do not match what is required for any of the potential methods.
        java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException - if an unknown problem prevents this reflective operation from completing successfully.
        java.lang.Exception - if a checked exception is thrown when a matching method is successfully invoked.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if an unchecked exception is thrown when a matching method is successfully invoked.
        java.lang.Error - if an error is thrown when a matching method is successfully invoked.

      • setModelProperty

        protected final void setModelProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
                                      java.lang.Object... newParams)
                               throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                      java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                      java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException,
                                      java.lang.Exception
        Invokes the setter method for the named property on one of the models assigned to this controller. This method is invoked through reflection using the provided parameters. If the property name submitted is not a property contained by the models assigned to this controller, an exception will be thrown. If the setter invoked throws an exception, or if the reflective method is unable to successfully invoke the method, the appropriate exception will be thrown.

        This method is capable of reflectively invoking ANY method provided to it, so long as that method is public and matches the types of the parameters submitted here. However, if multiple methods that would invoke successfully are provided in the list, this method will only end up invoking one of them. Multiple invocations risk interfering with the consistency of the operation, and therefore this method ends after the first successful invocation even if there are other methods remaining to test.

        The order of the methods is affected by the order models were added to this controller, but ultimately the order they are tested in cannot be completely guaranteed. As such, it is highly recommended to keep method names across all the models added to this controller unique, thus avoiding this issue.

        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property to invoke the setter of.
        newParams - the parameters to pass to the setter method. These are optional, and the method will still run if no parameters are passed if the setter can accept a no-argument invocation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if no matching setter method can be found. if the application does not have access to invoke the method.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the application does not have access to invoke the method.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any or all of the parameters submitted do not match what is required for any of the potential methods.
        java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException - if an unknown problem prevents this reflective operation from completing successfully.
        java.lang.Exception - if a checked exception is thrown when a matching method is successfully invoked.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if an unchecked exception is thrown when a matching method is successfully invoked.
        java.lang.Error - if an error is thrown when a matching method is successfully invoked.

      • reflectMethod

        protected java.lang.Object reflectMethod(java.util.List<mvp.core.AbstractController.ModelMethod> matchingMethods,
                                         java.lang.Object... newParams)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                         java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException,
                                         java.lang.Exception
        Parses the list of potentially matching methods, and attempts to invoke them through reflection with the provided parameters. If the method invoked returns a value, it is returned by this method. If not, then null is returned. If invoking the method throws an exception, or not method is successfully invoked, the appropriate exception will be thrown.

        This method is capable of reflectively invoking ANY method provided to it, so long as the parameters provided match what the method requires. However, if multiple methods that would invoke successfully are provided in the list, this method will only end up invoking one of them. Multiple invocations risk interfering with the consistency of the return type, and therefore this method ends after the first successful invocation even if there are other methods remaining to test.

        The order methods will be invoked is determined by the list passed to this method, and this method can make no other guarantees about the order. It is highly recommended to avoid situations where multiple matching methods could be passed to this method.

        Parameters:
        matchingMethods - list of ModelMethod containers with potentially matching methods.
        newParams - the parameters submitted for invocation on a matching method. These are optional, and the method will still run if no parameters are passed if the method can accept a no-argument invocation.
        Returns:
        the return value of the method invoked. If no return value, then null is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the application does not have access to invoke the method.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any or all of the parameters submitted do not match what is required for any of the potential methods.
        java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException - if an unknown problem prevents this reflective operation from completing successfully.
        java.lang.Exception - if a checked exception is thrown when a matching method is successfully invoked.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if an unchecked exception is thrown when a matching method is successfully invoked.
        java.lang.Error - if an error is thrown when a matching method is successfully invoked.
